brief: A user-space cooperatively scheduled thread of control.
name: batt::Task

publicAttributes.details: When scheduling a task to run via `dispatch` would increase the nesting depth on the current thread to greater than `kMaxNestingDepth`, `post` is used instead.
publicAttributes.name: kMaxNestingDepth
publicAttributes.title: kMaxNestingDepth

publicAttributes.brief: The number of bytes to statically allocate for handler memory buffers.
publicAttributes.name: kHandlerMemoryBytes
publicAttributes.summary: The number of bytes to statically allocate for handler memory buffers.
publicAttributes.title: kHandlerMemoryBytes

publicAttributes.brief: Set when code within the task requests a signal, because it is awaiting some external async event.
publicAttributes.name: kNeedSignal
publicAttributes.summary: Set when code within the task requests a signal, because it is awaiting some external async event.
publicAttributes.title: kNeedSignal

publicAttributes.brief: Set when the continuation generated by an `await` is invoked.
publicAttributes.name: kHaveSignal
publicAttributes.summary: Set when the continuation generated by an await is invoked.
publicAttributes.title: kHaveSignal

publicAttributes.brief: Set when the task is not currently running.
publicAttributes.name: kSuspended
publicAttributes.summary: Set when the task is not currently running.
publicAttributes.title: kSuspended

publicAttributes.brief: Indicates the task has finished execution.
publicAttributes.name: kTerminated
publicAttributes.summary: Indicates the task has finished execution.
publicAttributes.title: kTerminated

publicAttributes.brief: Set to request that the task collect a stack trace the next time it resumes.
publicAttributes.name: kStackTrace
publicAttributes.summary: Set to request that the task collect a stack trace the next time it resumes.
publicAttributes.title: kStackTrace

publicAttributes.brief: Spin-lock bit to serialize access to the sleep timer member of the [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicAttributes.name: kSleepTimerLock
publicAttributes.summary: Spin-lock bit to serialize access to the sleep timer member of the Task.
publicAttributes.title: kSleepTimerLock

publicAttributes.brief: Spin-lock bit to serialize access to the completions handlers list.
publicAttributes.name: kCompletionHandlersLock
publicAttributes.summary: Spin-lock bit to serialize access to the completions handlers list.
publicAttributes.title: kCompletionHandlersLock

publicAttributes.brief: Used to save the value of the `kSleepTimerLock` bit when the [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is suspended (e.g., in `await` or `yield`).
publicAttributes.details: The [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) should not hold any spinlocks while it is suspended, so we don't deadlock. Rather, the sleep timer lock is temporarily released while suspended and then re-acquired when the task is resumed.
publicAttributes.name: kSleepTimerLockSuspend
publicAttributes.summary: Used to save the value of the kSleepTimerLock bit when the Task is suspended (e.g., in await or yield).
publicAttributes.title: kSleepTimerLockSuspend

publicAttributes.brief: State bit to indicate that completion handlers should not be added to the list, but called immediately.
publicAttributes.name: kCompletionHandlersClosed
publicAttributes.summary: State bit to indicate that completion handlers should not be added to the list, but called immediately.
publicAttributes.title: kCompletionHandlersClosed

publicAttributes.brief: The number of state flags defined above.
publicAttributes.name: kNumStateFlags
publicAttributes.summary: The number of state flags defined above.
publicAttributes.title: kNumStateFlags

publicClasses.brief: Stack trace and debug information collected from a [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicClasses.name: batt::Task::DebugTrace
publicClasses.summary: Stack trace and debug information collected from a Task.
publicClasses.title: batt::Task::DebugTrace

publicFunctions.name: Task

publicFunctions.brief: Create a new [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) with a custom stack size.
publicFunctions.name: Task
publicFunctions.summary: Create a new Task with a custom stack size.
publicFunctions.title: Task

publicFunctions.argsString: (const boost::asio::any_io_executor &ex, BodyFn &&body_fn, std::string &&name=default_name(), StackSize stack_size=StackSize{512 *1024}, StackType stack_type=StackType::kFixedSize, Optional< Priority > priority=None) noexcept
publicFunctions.brief: Create a new [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/), optionally setting name, stack size, stack type, and priority.
publicFunctions.details: The default priority for a [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is the current task priority plus 100; this means that a new [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) by default will always "soft-preempt" the currently running task.
publicFunctions.name: Task
publicFunctions.summary: Create a new Task, optionally setting name, stack size, stack type, and priority.
publicFunctions.title: Task

publicFunctions.brief: Destroy the [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicFunctions.details: A [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) must be terminated when it is destroyed, or the program will panic. Calling `[Task::join()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-join)` prior to destroying a [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) object is sufficient.
publicFunctions.name: ~Task
publicFunctions.summary: Destroy the Task.
publicFunctions.title: ~Task

publicFunctions.brief: The unique id number assigned to this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicFunctions.name: id
publicFunctions.summary: The unique id number assigned to this Task.
publicFunctions.title: id

publicFunctions.brief: The user-friendly name assigned to this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicFunctions.name: name
publicFunctions.summary: The user-friendly name assigned to this Task.
publicFunctions.title: name

publicFunctions.brief: The scheduling priority of this task; higher == more urgent.
publicFunctions.name: get_priority
publicFunctions.summary: The scheduling priority of this task; higher == more urgent.
publicFunctions.title: get_priority

publicFunctions.brief: Assigns a new priority to this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicFunctions.details: This method will not trigger a yield or activation; it only affects future scheduling decisions.
publicFunctions.name: set_priority
publicFunctions.summary: Assigns a new priority to this Task.
publicFunctions.title: set_priority

publicFunctions.brief: The current byte offset of the top of this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/)'s stack.
publicFunctions.details: This value is only meaningful if this method is called while on the current task. Usually you should just call `[batt::Task::current_stack_pos()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-current-stack-pos)` instead.
publicFunctions.name: stack_pos
publicFunctions.summary: The current byte offset of the top of this Task's stack.
publicFunctions.title: stack_pos

publicFunctions.brief: The byte offset of the given pointer relative to the base of this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/)'s stack; return value is undefined if `ptr` is not on the stack of this Task!
publicFunctions.name: stack_pos_of
publicFunctions.summary: The byte offset of the given pointer relative to the base of this Task's stack; return value is undefined if ptr is not on the stack of this Task!
publicFunctions.title: stack_pos_of

publicFunctions.brief: Block the current Task/thread until this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) has finished.
publicFunctions.name: join
publicFunctions.summary: Block the current Task/thread until this Task has finished.
publicFunctions.title: join

publicFunctions.brief: Returns whether or not this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is finished.
publicFunctions.details:
Equivalent to `[is_done()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-is-done)`.

This function is guaranteed never to block.
publicFunctions.name: try_join
publicFunctions.summary: Returns whether or not this Task is finished.
publicFunctions.title: try_join

publicFunctions.brief: Interrupts a call to `sleep` on this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/).
publicFunctions.details: Has no effect if the [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is not inside `sleep`.
publicFunctions.name: wake
publicFunctions.summary: Interrupts a call to sleep on this Task.
publicFunctions.title: wake

publicFunctions.brief: The executor passed in to this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) at construction time.
publicFunctions.name: get_executor
publicFunctions.summary: The executor passed in to this Task at construction time.
publicFunctions.title: get_executor

publicFunctions.brief: Returns whether or not this [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is finished.
publicFunctions.name: is_done
publicFunctions.summary: Returns whether or not this Task is finished.
publicFunctions.title: is_done

publicFunctions.brief: Attaches a listener callback to the task; this callback will be invoked when the task completes execution.
publicFunctions.details: This method can be thought of as an asynchronous version of [batt::Task::join](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-join).
publicFunctions.name: call_when_done

paramList.name: handler
paramList.text: The handler to invoke when the [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) has finished; should have the signature `void()`

publicFunctions.summary: Attaches a listener callback to the task; this callback will be invoked when the task completes execution.
publicFunctions.title: call_when_done

publicFunctions.brief: Thread-local counter that limits stack growth while running Tasks via `dispatch`.
publicFunctions.name: nesting_depth
publicFunctions.summary: Thread-local counter that limits stack growth while running Tasks via dispatch.
publicFunctions.title: nesting_depth

publicFunctions.brief: Returns true iff the given state is _not_ a suspended state.
publicFunctions.name: is_running_state
publicFunctions.summary: Returns true iff the given state is not a suspended state.
publicFunctions.title: is_running_state

publicFunctions.brief: Returns true iff the task is not currently running, but is ready to be resumed.
publicFunctions.name: is_ready_state
publicFunctions.summary: Returns true iff the task is not currently running, but is ready to be resumed.
publicFunctions.title: is_ready_state

publicFunctions.brief: Returns true if the passed state represents a fully terminated task.
publicFunctions.name: is_terminal_state
publicFunctions.summary: Returns true if the passed state represents a fully terminated task.
publicFunctions.title: is_terminal_state

publicFunctions.brief: Returns a reference to the global mutex that protects the global task list.
publicFunctions.name: global_mutex
publicFunctions.summary: Returns a reference to the global mutex that protects the global task list.
publicFunctions.title: global_mutex

publicFunctions.brief: Returns a reference to the global task list.
publicFunctions.details: Must only be accessed while holding a lock on `[Task::global_mutex()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-global-mutex)`.
publicFunctions.name: all_tasks
publicFunctions.summary: Returns a reference to the global task list.
publicFunctions.title: all_tasks

publicFunctions.brief: Returns a reference to the currently running [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/), if there is one.
publicFunctions.details: WARNING: if this method is called outside of any [batt::Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/), behavior is undefined.
publicFunctions.name: current
publicFunctions.summary: Returns a reference to the currently running Task, if there is one.
publicFunctions.title: current

publicFunctions.brief: Returns the current task name, or "" if there is no current task.
publicFunctions.details: Unlike [batt::Task::current()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-current), this method is safe to call outside a task.
publicFunctions.name: current_name
publicFunctions.summary: Returns the current task name, or "" if there is no current task.
publicFunctions.title: current_name

publicFunctions.brief: Returns the unique id number of the current [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) or thread.
publicFunctions.name: current_id
publicFunctions.summary: Returns the unique id number of the current Task or thread.
publicFunctions.title: current_id

publicFunctions.brief: Returns the current stack position, if currently inside a task.
publicFunctions.name: current_stack_pos
returns: If called from inside a task, the current stack position in bytes, else `batt::None`
publicFunctions.summary: Returns the current stack position, if currently inside a task.
publicFunctions.title: current_stack_pos

publicFunctions.brief: brief Returns the stack position of `ptr` relative to the current stack base, if currently inside a task.
publicFunctions.details: NOTE: If `ptr` isn't actually on the current task's stack, then this function will still return a number, but it will be essentially a garbage value. It's up to the caller to make sure that `ptr` points at something on the task stack.
publicFunctions.name: current_stack_pos_of
returns: If called from inside a task, the stack offset in bytes of `ptr`, else `batt::None`
publicFunctions.summary: brief Returns the stack position of ptr relative to the current stack base, if currently inside a task.
publicFunctions.title: current_stack_pos_of

publicFunctions.brief: Dumps stack traces and debug info from all Tasks and threads to stderr.
publicFunctions.name: backtrace_all

paramList.name: force
paramList.text: If true, then this function will attempt to dump debug information for running tasks, even though this may cause data races (if you're debugging a tricky threading issue, sometimes the risk of a crash is outweighed by the benefit of some additional clues about what's going on!)

publicFunctions.summary: Dumps stack traces and debug info from all Tasks and threads to stderr.
publicFunctions.title: backtrace_all

publicFunctions.brief: Yields control from the current Task/thread, allowing other tasks to run.
publicFunctions.details: Suspends the current task and immediately schedules it to resume via `boost::asio::post`.
publicFunctions.name: yield
publicFunctions.summary: Yields control from the current Task/thread, allowing other tasks to run.
publicFunctions.title: yield

publicFunctions.brief: Puts the current Task/thread to sleep for the specified duration.
publicFunctions.details:
This operation can be interrupted by a [batt::Task::wake()](#batttaskwake), in which case a "cancelled" error code is returned instead of success (no error).

This method is safe to call outside a task; in this case, it is implemented via `std::this_task::sleep_for`.
publicFunctions.name: sleep
returns: `batt::ErrorCode{}` (no error) if the specified duration passed, else `boost::asio::error::operation_aborted` (indicating that `[batt::Task::wake()](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/#function-wake)` was called on the given task)
publicFunctions.summary: Puts the current Task/thread to sleep for the specified duration.
publicFunctions.title: sleep

publicFunctions.brief: Suspends the current thread/Task until an asynchronous event occurs.
publicFunctions.name: await
publicFunctions.summary: Suspends the current thread/Task until an asynchronous event occurs.
publicFunctions.title: await

publicFunctions.brief: Suspends the current thread/Task until an asynchronous event occurs.
publicFunctions.details: This overload takes the return type as an explicit formal parameter (instead of a template parameter).
publicFunctions.name: await
publicFunctions.summary: Suspends the current thread/Task until an asynchronous event occurs.
publicFunctions.title: await

publicFunctions.name: await
publicFunctions.summary: Suspends the current thread/Task until the passed Future is ready.
publicFunctions.title: await

publicFunctions.name: default_name

publicFunctions.brief: Returns the priority of the current [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) (or the default priority if no [Task](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Task/) is active).
publicFunctions.details: NOTE: this function is safe to call outside of a task; in this case, the default priority (0) is returned.
publicFunctions.name: current_priority
publicFunctions.summary: Returns the priority of the current Task (or the default priority if no Task is active).
publicFunctions.title: current_priority

publicFunctions.brief: Returns true iff the current Task/thread is inside a [Worker]()'s work function.
publicFunctions.details: Used to avoid double-wait deadlocks on the same thread inside parallel algorithms.
publicFunctions.name: inside_work_fn
publicFunctions.summary: Returns true iff the current Task/thread is inside a Worker's work function.
publicFunctions.title: inside_work_fn

publicTypes.summary: The executor for a Task; this type is responsible for running the Task via boost::asio::post and/or boost::asio::dispatch.
